name: Ganea conjecture
rephrased: The Lusternik-Schniremann category of the product space X × S^n equals the category of X plus one, for any positive integer n.
implication_form: If X is a topological space and n is a positive integer, then the category of X × S^n is equal to the category of X plus 1.
explained: The Ganea conjecture, now known to be false, was a statement in algebraic topology regarding the Lusternik-Schnirelmann category (denoted as cat(X)). It claimed that for any topological space X and any positive integer n, the category of the product space X × S^n equals the category of X plus one. That is, cat(X × S^n) = cat(X) + 1 for all n > 0.
related_conjectures: Other category-related conjectures in homotopy theory
